metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1855 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in xgene_hwmon_remove indrivers/hwmon/xgene-hwmon.c in the Hardware Monitoring Linux Kernel Driver(xgene-hwmon). This flaw could allow a local attacker to crash the systemdue to a race problem. This vulnerability could even lead to a kernelinformation leak problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
